publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-2804 Pauline McNeill: The College of Piping-That the Parliament notes with pleasure the recent £300,000 end of year flexibility grant to the Piping Centre in Glasgow; regrets, however, that once again the College of Piping, which has been in existence since 1944, currently has more than 150 pupils on its register and maintains a teaching network covering the whole of Scotland, has failed to receive similar support, and therefore calls on the Scottish Executive to consider distributing financial support to such bodies in a fairer and more equitable way.
S1M-2804 The College of Piping (lodged on 27 February 2002) Maureen Macmillan*

S1M-2804 Pauline McNeill: The College of Piping-That the Parliament notes with pleasure the recent £300,000 end of year flexibility grant to the Piping Centre in Glasgow; regrets, however, that once again the College of Piping, which has been in existence since 1944, currently has more than 150 pupils on its register and maintains a teaching network covering the whole of Scotland, has failed to receive similar support, and therefore calls on the Scottish Executive to consider distributing financial support to such bodies in a fairer and more equitable way. Supported by: Maureen Macmillan, Tommy Sheridan*, Michael Russell*
S1M-2804 The College of Piping (lodged on 27 February 2002) Stewart Stevenson*, Donald Gorrie*
S1M-2804 The College of Piping (lodged on 27 February 2002) Christine Grahame*
S1M-2804 The College of Piping (lodged on 27 February 2002) Trish Godman*
S1M-2804 The College of Piping (lodged on 27 February 2002) Johann Lamont*, Mr Jamie Stone*
S1M-2804 The College of Piping (lodged on 27 February 2002) Nora Radcliffe*
S1M-2804 The College of Piping (lodged on 27 February 2002) Ms Sandra White*
S1M-2804 The College of Piping (lodged on 27 February 2002) Brian Fitzpatrick*, Alasdair Morgan*
S1M-2804 The College of Piping (lodged on 27 February 2002) Mr Gil Paterson*
S1M-2804 The College of Piping (lodged on 27 February 2002) Irene McGugan*
